intro: Aciotis caulialata, commonly known as the woolly leaf daisy, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. Aciotis caulialata is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive appearance and drought tolerance.
